content: Hello! I am totally new here but excited to go down this rabbit hole!
I have just watched this video on GPT-3 codex, and was wondering if the same approach could be used on the language of maths itself? Try and generate some Godel problem breaking AI :)
There's a whole stream dedicated to this topic: #Machine Learning for Theorem Proving

I donâ€™t know enough about Codex yet, but you may be interested in Lean gpt-f which itself is a collaboration with Stan Polu at OpenAI. Stan and Jesse Han and others are working on a number of projects applying AI to theorem proving. Here are some resources on Lean gpt-f.

  • stream: #lean-gptf
  • paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/2102.06203
  • repo: https://github.com/jesse-michael-han/lean-gptf
  • short talk: https://iclr.cc/virtual/2021/workshop/2124#collapse-sl-3634
  • long talk: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=EXpmbAfBNnw
